context: The NES Test Station's front features a <a3_0><b7_0>Game Pak slot<b7_0/><a3_0/> and connectors for testing various components (AC adapter, RF switch, Audio/Video cable, NES Control Deck, accessories and games), with a centrally-located selector knob to chose which component to test. The unit itself weighs approximately <a0_0><b4_0>11.7<b4_0/><a0_0/> pounds without a TV. It connects to a television via a combined A/V and RF Switch cable. By actuating the green button, a user can toggle between an A/V Cable or RF Switch connection. The television it is connected to (<a1_0>typically <b5_0>11" to 14"<b5_0/><a1_0/>) is meant to be placed <a2_0><b6_0>atop<b6_0/><a2_0/> it.
